work.p: Draft written on an opened envelope. These three lines later appeared as part of "L. of G.'s Purport."

titleStmt.title: Death dogs my steps
a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman

notesStmt.note: This draft was likely written in 1890, the date postmarked on the envelope.
The poem is written on an envelope sent from London, addressed to Whitman and postmarked March 3, 1890.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Death dogs my steps
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

lg.head: Death dogs my steps,
lg.l: I sing of life, yet mind me well of death;

To-day Death dogs my steps, and has for years,
my seated shape,
Draws sometimes close to me, as face to face.
